content: delilah the darling duck measurements approximately 8 5 tall sitting 11 tall standing and 6 wide materials worsted weight yarn in pale yellow and orange 2 12mm safety eyes 4 5mm hook polyester fiberfill or other toy filling yarn needle stitch marker design notes for this pattern i used caron 1lb i find this worsted weight yarn to be thicker than other worsted weight yarns if using any other brand i suggest using a 4 0mm crochet hook you can use any yarn weight and appropriate hook to create this pattern this will affect the size of your finished piece amigurumi does need to be crocheted tightly so the stuffing does not show through if using a different yarn weight make sure to use a smaller hook than the yarn recommends in addition safety eyes can be considered a choking hazard if you intend on giving this doll to a child under 3 years old it is highly suggested you use yarn eyes in place of the plastic safety eyes pattern copyright ©2015 megan alameda all rights reserved pattern may not be altered copied redistributed or sold as your own pattern you may sell the finished product on a small scale as long as credit for pattern is given to happy hook designs and link to my sites are provided www facebook com/happyhookdesign page 1 of 3 abbreviations chain chain single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch increase two single crochets in one stitch decrease 1 single_crochet over two stitches round round st stitch repeat instructions between the asterisks as many times as indicated in the pattern total number of stitches at the end of the round this pattern is made in continuous rounds place a finish stuffing neck and body stuff neck firmly stitch marker in the first stitch of each round as you round 40 decrease 6 times 6 progress through the pattern slip_stitch in first st of previous round fasten_off leaving long tail whip stitch opening closed head & body with pale yellow yarn beak chain 2 with orange yarn round 1 6 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook 6 chain 9 round 2 increase 6 times 12 round 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each st round 3 increase single_crochet in next st repeat 6 times 18 across 8 chain 1 turn round 4 increase single_crochet in next 2 st repeat 6 times 24 working in rounds moving forward round 5 increase single_crochet in next 3 st repeat 6 times 30 round 2 single_crochet in blo across back of beak continue round 6 increase single_crochet in next 4 st repeat 6 times 36 around front of beak and single_crochet in flo across front of round 7 single_crochet in all 36 st 36 beak 16 round 8 increase single_crochet in next 5 st repeat 6 times 42 round 3-6 single_crochet in all 16 st 16 round 9-14 single_crochet in all 42 st 42 slip_stitch in first st of previous round fasten_off leaving round 15 decrease single_crochet in
